incidents.name: Programmable Voice Experiencing One-Way Audio Issue

incident_updates.body: We are pleased to inform that the issue with Programmable Voice one-way audio in the AU region has been fully resolved. Our monitoring indicates that the service has returned to normal operation, and we have observed a full recovery.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Failures to Multiple Networks in Bangladesh

We have proceeded to contact the impacted customers directly while we continue working on a resolution with our carrier partner for Banglalink and Teletalk Networks. incidents.name: Encoding Issue for Worker Attributes in Flex

incident_updates.body: Flex was degraded between 07:51 UTC on 07/19/2024 and 05:15pm UTC on 07/26/2024. During this period, customers may have experienced issues with tasks being assigned to workers in the event the workers had special characters as part of their attribute skills and updated these skills during the impact window. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Super Sim Was Affected

incident_updates.body: Between 22:10 and 22:25 UTC we investigated an issue where devices using Super SIM may have experienced delays in attaching to the network. The SIM needed to failover to another IMSI in order to successfully attach to the network. We are actively monitoring the situation and working with our partner to understand what happened. We will provide another update if more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super Sim. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Programmable Messaging API Was Affected

incident_updates.body: The Twilio Programmable Messaging API was partially degraded starting from Jul 24th, 2024, 14:53 PST to 14:55 PST. During this time, customers sending messages may receive 5xx's in API responses. The system has recovered and is operational.

incidents.name: Connectivity Lost on ~8% of Super SIM Devices in the US

incident_updates.body: Connectivity issue on 8% of Super SIM devices is operating normally at this time. This issue has been resolved.

Our engineering team has put in a fix to address the issue causing 8% of active data sessions on Super SIM being dropped. We are seeing recovery and are continuing to monitor for service performance. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 1:05 UTC, we observed that approximately 8% of active data sessions on Super SIM were dropped for devices connected in the US on T-Mobile. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted instance recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
In the meantime, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices.

Beginning at 1:05 UTC, we observed that approximately 8% of active data sessions on Super SIM were dropped for devices connected in the US on T-Mobile. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted instance recovered. Our engineering team is actively working with the affected network provider to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
In the meantime, we kindly suggest that customers reset the connectivity through the console if they notice that some of their SIM cards are still experiencing issues. This can often help re-establish a stable connection for the affected devices.
